title: Workshop program
text:
Note



Please note that the program is preliminary and might be subject to change, especially the exact schedule.


All times are in Central European Summer Time (CEST).







Time
Event




10:00 - 10:10
Welcome


10:10 - 10:30
Introduction to Julia & Unfold.jl


10:30 - 11:30
Mass univariate linear models


11:30 - 11:45
‚òï Break


11:45 - 12:45
Continuous predictors & marginal effects


12:45 - 13:45
ü•ô Lunch break


13:45 - 14:30

14:30 - 14:45
‚òï Break


14:45 - 15:45
Overlap correction & multiple event types


15:45 - 16:00
‚òï Break


16:00 - 16:30
Lightning talks: UnfoldMakie.jl, UnfoldSim.jl, UnfoldBIDS.jl, UnfoldMixedModels.jl


16:30 - 16:45
Wrap-up





Each lesson consists of a lecture (~ 30min) and a subsequent exercise (~30min).

title: Welcome! üêô
text: Welcome to the first official Unfold.jl workshop! Here you will learn everything to be able to do your first Unfold analysis! The workshop will be free and fully online, so you can join from anywhere in the world.

title: Welcome! üêô
text:
What even is Unfold? ü§î
Unfold.jl is a Julia Package for regression and event-based time series analysis, with a focus on regression ERPs for EEG analysis.
If you‚Äôre not already familiar with Unfold or regression ERP‚Äôs, we recommend you to read the original publication by Ehinger & Dimigen.

title: Welcome! üêô
text:
Material covered üí™
During the workshop we will cover everything from mass-univariate modeling of EEG data to marginalized effects and overlap correction. For more information please have a look at our (preliminary) schedule.

title: Welcome! üêô

title: Registration
text:
Note



Since our capacity for the practical exercises is limited, we will only be able to accept ~50 participants for the workshop. However, the lectures will also be available via livestream, and everyone is invited to follow along independently.


To register for the free Unfold.jl workshop, please fill out the form below until 07.05.2025. We will inform you via email if you got a place and share the Zoom link.

title: Installation guide
text:
To actively participate in the workshop and use the notebooks we provided, you will need to install both Julia and Pluto.jl on your system. The following is a minimal guide on how to do this. You can find more extensive information in the Pluto.jl documentation (which this guide is based on) and also watch their instruction video.
In this video, Romy and Ruman show how to install everything using the steps below.

title: Installation guide
text:
Step 1: Installing Julia
In most cases, we recommend installing Julia through the julia-version manager juliaup. This will allow you in the future to easily update and switch between different Julia versions.
Windows: Windows app store or run winget install --name Julia --id 9NJNWW8PVKMN -e -s msstore in a cmd.exe
MacOS/Linux: open a terminal and run curl -fsSL https://install.julialang.org | sh
‚ùå Something didn‚Äôt work? Try following the instructions here. You can also ask questions in our Unfold.jl github-discussion group
If all things fail, you can also try to go to https://julialang.org/downloads and install the latest stable release.

title: Installation guide
text:
Step 2: Run Julia
Make sure that you can run Julia. To do this, open a terminal and type julia. You should then see the below startup message and your terminal should say ‚Äújulia‚Äù.

title: Installation guide
text:
Step 3: Install Pluto
To install Pluto type
import Pkg; Pkg.add("Pluto")
into the Julia terminal (i.e.¬†after step 2)

title: Installation guide
text:
Step 4: Run Pluto
To run Pluto.jl, simply type the following in the Julia terminal:
import Pluto; Pluto.run()
This will start up a Pluto session and automatically open your browser.

title: Installation guide
text:
Step 5: Installing the required packages
We are providing a ‚Äúpackage installation‚Äù notebook. This will make sure that everyone will be using the same package versions. Please run this one before any of the other notebooks.

Copy this link to the installation notebook:

https://github.com/s-ccs/workshop_unfold_2025/blob/main/00_installation.jl

Put it in the Pluto.jl box next to open a notebook.
Confirm that you want to start this notebook!
Grab a ‚òï - it will take 10-15 minutes to install all packages.
And then you are all done and ready for the workshop üéâ

title: Material
text: Here you can find the direct links to all the material we provide during the workshop. After the workshop, we will also link to all recorded lectures here. For a guide on how to install Julia/Pluto and how to use the notebooks, please see our installation page.
